abstract.text: Declare the user interface and behavior for your app on every platform.
A type-erased gesture.
A dragging motion that invokes an action as the drag-event sequence changes.
A gesture that consists of two gestures where only one of them can succeed.
An instance that matches a sequence of events to a gesture, and returns a
stream of values for each of its states.
The type of gesture representing the body of
The type representing the gesture’s value.
The content and behavior of the gesture.
Combines two gestures exclusively to create a new gesture where only one
gesture succeeds, giving precedence to the first gesture.
Customizes the activation behavior for a gesture when driven by hand
or hand-like input.
Returns a gesture that uses the given closure to map over this
gesture’s value.
Combines a gesture with keyboard modifiers.
Adds an action to perform when the gesture’s value changes.
Adds an action to perform when the gesture ends.
Sequences a gesture with another one to create a new gesture, which
results in the second gesture only receiving events after the first
gesture succeeds.
Combines a gesture with another gesture to create a new gesture that
recognizes both gestures at the same time.
Requires this gesture to target an entity.
Requires this gesture to target an entity or a descendant of entity.
Requires this gesture to target an entity that can be found in the results of the query.
Updates the provided gesture state property as the gesture’s value
changes.
A gesture that updates the state provided by a gesture’s updating callback.
An activation behavior specific to hand-driven input.
Hand gesture shortcuts describe finger and wrist movements that the user can
perform in order to activate a button or toggle.
A gesture that succeeds when the user performs a long press.
A gesture that recognizes a magnification motion and tracks the amount of
magnification.
A gesture that recognizes a magnification motion and tracks the amount of
magnification.
A gesture that recognizes a rotation motion and tracks the angle of the
rotation.
A gesture that recognizes 3D rotation motion and tracks the angle and axis
of the rotation.
A gesture that recognizes a rotation motion and tracks the angle of the rotation.
A gesture that’s a sequence of two gestures.
A gesture containing two gestures that can happen at the same time with
neither of them preceding the other.
A gesture that provides information about ongoing spatial events like
clicks and touches.
A gesture that recognizes one or more taps and reports their location.
A gesture that recognizes one or more taps.
Sets the screen edge from which you want your gesture to take
precedence over the system gesture.
Assigns a hand gesture shortcut to the modified control.
Attaches a gesture to the view with a higher precedence than gestures
defined by the view.
Attaches a gesture to the view with a higher precedence than gestures
defined by the view.
Attaches a gesture to the view with a higher precedence than gestures
defined by the view.
A gesture that recognizes the motion of and handles dragging a window.
A singleton actor whose executor is equivalent to the main dispatch queue.
